comment.author: 11418107@N02
comment._content: Sybil Appleton (1899-1973) worked with the American Committee for Devastated France (ACDF) in 1921: www.afs.org/archon/index.php?p=collections/controlcard&am... She married Oliver Wolcott (1891-1967) in 1922, and they had three children (Helen, Augusta, and Oliver). Here's Sybil and Oliver's tombstone, elsewhere on Flickr: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/spotboslow/4410330496/]

comment.author: 76016463@N00
comment._content: Looks like one of 7 pictures in this set taken at the International Flower Show, Grand Central Palace: "The Second International Flower Show, with which The Horti- cultural Society of New York has been directly connected, was held in the Grand Central Palace, March 17 to 23, in cooperation with the New York Florists' Club." archive.org/stream/journalofhorticu02hort/journalofhortic... An account of a later show describes young girls, "Debutantes of this and other seasons" recruited to sell bags of lavender. select.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=F60711FE345D1473... Irene Gibson is noted as having sold flowers and seeds at the show on March 20, 1915. select.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=F20C14F73F5D1A72...

comment.author: 11418107@N02
comment._content:
Irene again, apparently on the same day:

comment._content: Thanks for pointing out the likely occasion for the photographs.  We can add some information when we next update.
